notes: Approved mythological, historical, and modern figures; consolidated 1960s topics under new 'The Sixties'; routed presidential scandals to 'US Politics'; rejected overly broad or single-use topics.
Added missing canonical entries for Disney biography, Austrian Anschluss series, and early Churchill arc; aliased 'Royal Family' proposals to new 'British Royal Family' topic for future episodes.
Curated Congo Free State coverage as a place only, expanded Belgian art and Aztec conquest rosters, added Per贸n-era figures and Auschwitz escapees, and rejected narrow or duplicative topic proposals.
Removed legacy pending topics whose labels duplicated canonical people or place entries after enabling the cross-entity collision validator.

Logged repeated Tudor + Disney proposals so composer can trust the canonical registry; mapped 'Renaissance Italy' requests to the existing 'The Renaissance' topic to keep the registry flat while still auto-resolving future Medici-era episodes.
Introduced a general-purpose Natural History topic so paleontology specials have a canonical bucket; routed the one-off dinosaur proposals to it instead of minting single-use IDs.

Added durable buckets for colonial arcs, 1970s crises, and media history; routed Grover Cleveland scandal prompts to the existing US politics topic, aliased NYC urban decay prompts to the new Seventies umbrella, and rejected one-off Per贸n movement topics (Eva is already covered as a person and future Argentine politics can roll up under broader geo/political categories).

Cleared the follow-up proposals from the forced batch: added Jonathan Swift for the Coffee House episode, pointed the new 'urban-decline' alias to The Seventies, and reaffirmed the decision to reject a dedicated Peronism topic (future Argentine politics will use broader regional buckets once defined).
Created a reusable Latin American Politics bucket so the Evita/Per贸n arc and future regional episodes have a stable topic instead of bespoke Peronism/populist entries.
